content:
Have been exercising beta 3 on MacOS. My working rig is a MacBook (recently M2) (with(retina display) connected to a 27" Thunderbolt Display (not Retina). Beta works on both but...
When I drag the frame from one to the other, the frame and everything else adjusts except the canvas window size.
So here is what I see on my Thunderbolt Display:
Non-Retina.png

I then drag the frame onto the MacBook and see this:
Retina.png
The canvas has failed to adjust to the higher DPI.

As a further exploration, I switched to dual canvas while on the Retina display, The second canvas is sized appropriately.
Retina-dual.png
I then dragged the frame back onto the non-Retina display.
Non-Retina-dual.png

The canvas adjusts. Note how the amount of chart you see on the canvas adjusts, while the canvas window size does not.

I note that wx3.2 includes

High DPI support with the new, but almost perfectly backwards- compatible, API based on wxBitmapBundle, including per-monitor DPI and dynamic DPI changes.

Perhaps something needs to trigger a window resize?
